Here Are The Major Challenges Sourav Ganguly Faces As The New President Of The BCCI

Here Are The Major Challenges Sourav Ganguly Faces As The New President Of The BCCI

Sourav Ganguly shall be a busy man during his tenure as the president of the BCCI. There are a lot of challenges that he will have to face head on.

So what are they exactly? Let's take a look.

1. India's position in the ICC

bccl

He will look to ensure that BCCI gets get $405 million as its share of revenues which is more than anyone else.

He said that he would look to get back the $372 million from the 8-year cycle (2016-2023) where we host the 2021 World T20 along with the 2023 World Cup.

2. Tax rebates for 2016 World T20 and future ICC events held in India

bccl

Don't Miss 2.2 K SHARES 6.2 K SHARES 142 SHARES 507 SHARES

One solution could be asking Star Sports to carry the tax burden as they have a big set-up in India

3. Payment of domestic cricketers

bccl/representational image

Players are paid less than in international cricket, but it is an issue he has always wanted to look into.

4. Domestic Structure

bccl

Competitions like Deodhar Trophy and spacing Ranji Trophy games need to be looked at along with umpiring standards.

5. Day/Night Test cricket

afp

Ganguly has supported Day/Night Test matches and feels the crowds will be back. Having them in India is his dream and let's see if it happens when he is in charge.

6. Conflict of Interest Issue

bccl

The last CoA Status Report wants some leeway on the rule . If the Top Court says yes, Ganguly can bring in quality ex-players for some key roles.

With Inputs From PTI.
